attributes.action: Review this year A-level and GCSE grades results to accept teachers recomndation
attributes.additional_details: The algorythm caused a major downgrade in exam results making over 40% exam results downgraded. The results are not fair and in several cases the grades have beed downgraded beyond reason makin students with expected B grades to receive E or even U. As the appeal and taking exam in autum may cause students to lose a year would like goverment step in and request OFQAL to accept predicted grades as exam results.
attributes.background: Due to high discrappency between predicted and calculated grades, and unfair calculating policy we would like the government to review the downgraded grades and accept predicted grades as exam reaults.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that GCSE and A-level students will receive their centre assessment grades: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/gcse-and-a-level-students-to-receive-centre-assessment-grades

Prior to this announcement being made, we had published the following petitions, calling for similar actions to your request: 

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

Allow free and accessible appeals of GCSE and A Level calculated grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334013
